text.title: Noun phrases komɛi i ni abuabuaa amɛ naa yɛ Akan mli
text.titleTranslation: A collection of Akan noun phrases
text.body:
obaa kɔkɔɔ kɛsi nimdzifoɔ na otina hɔ no

ɔbaa kɛsi kɔkɔɔ ɔkwadzofo no

bɛɛma tuntuu kitikiti papa no

bɛɛma kitikiti tuntuu papa no

saa nkramai mienu no

ɔbaa ɔɔtu nyom wɔ asɔre no 

akwadaa ɛɛba yɛ hɔ no 

akwadaa ɛɛba yɛ hɔ no  

nkoadaa fɛfɛɛfɛ no nyinaa ɛɛba yɛ ho na omɔshɛ atadeɛ kɔkɔɔ no 

bɛɛma ɔɔbɔ bɔɔlu no

Kwesi bɛ-yɛ edzuma no.

obɛdzi edziban no.

phrase.original: ɔbaa kɔkɔɔ kɛsi nimdzifoɔ na otina hɔ no
phrase.translation: The beautiful fat intelligent lady that is seated there

phrase.original: ɔbaa kɛsi kɔkɔɔ ɔkwadzofo no
phrase.translation: the fat fair lazy woman

phrase.original: bɛɛma tuntuu kitikiti papa no
phrase.translation: The dark little good man

phrase.original: bɛɛma kitikiti tuntuu papa no
phrase.translation: The little dark good man

phrase.original: saa nkramai mienu no
phrase.translation: Those two beautiful dogs

phrase.original: ɔbaa ɔɔtu nyom wɔ asɔre no
phrase.translation: The lady singing in the church/choir

phrase.original: akwadaa ɛɛba yɛ hɔ no
phrase.translation: The child coming towards us

phrase.original: akwadaa ɛɛba yɛ hɔ no
nkoadaa fɛfɛɛfɛ no nyinaa ɛɛbayɛ ho na omɔshɛ atadeɛ kɔkɔɔ no
phrase.translation: All the handsome children coming towards us that are in red

phrase.original: bɛɛma ɔɔbɔ bɔɔlu no
phrase.translation: The man playing the football

phrase.original: Kwesi bɛyɛ edzuma no.
phrase.translation: Kwesi will do the work

phrase.original: obɛdzi edziban no.
phrase.translation: S/he will eat the food

phrase.original: sε obi de dwumadi bi ba awiei na ɔfi bea hɔ.
phrase.translation: It means for someone to bring a work to an end and move away from the place.

phrase.original: Sε yεpɔn adwuma a, yεbεnantew akɔ fie.
phrase.translation: When we close from work we will walk home.

phrase.original: sε adwumawura ma obi a ne mbere aso (wɔ onyin mu) kwan ma ɔgyae adwuma.
phrase.translation: It means for an employer to allow someone who is at his retirement age to retire from work.

phrase.original: Papa Takyi di mfe aduosia a, wɔbεpɔn no adwuma.
phrase.translation: When Mr. Takyi turns 60 he will be made to retire from his work.
phrase.description:
What is this 'a' = COND, PRT really?
the 'sɛ' can be at the beginning of the sentence...sɛ papa takyi di mfeɛ aduosia a wobɛpɔn no adwuma.(if Mr Takyi turns 60, he will be made to retire from his work ) 'sɛ .........a' means if
I agree the 'a' is sort of a conditional particle

phrase.original: sε obi fi bea bi a εwɔ soro ba fam.
phrase.translation: To come down from a higher place.

phrase.original: Opoku too ne ho si fii dan no so.
phrase.translation: Opoku threw himself down from the top of the building.

phrase.original: sε adwumawura ma obi a ne mbere aso
(wɔ onyin mu) kwan ma ɔgyae adwuma
sε obi sua adwuma bi wie na ɔkɔyε amande ma ne wura
phrase.translation: If someone finish learning a career and goes to perform a profession for the boss
phrase.description: I think BOSS would rather fit the meaning of 'wura' than OWNER adwuma in this case will also mean learning a trade or career like dressmaking wura will then refer to the one who thought that person the trade/career

phrase.original: nam so gye ne ho na ɔtumi pae anaa tew ne ho
na ɔkɔyε amande ma ne wura
phrase.translation: And he/she goes to perform rites for his/her boss

phrase.original: nam so gye ne ho na ɔtumi pae anaa tew ne ho.
Kofi wea kɔ gyade
phrase.translation: Kofi crawls to the kitchen

phrase.original: Kofi wea ba gyade
phrase.translation: Kofi crawls to the kitchen

phrase.original: Aba puei fii adaka mu
phrase.translation: Aba emerged from inside a box

phrase.original: Aba nante fi fie
phrase.translation: Aba walks from the house

phrase.original: Yaw dwane fa ase
phrase.translation: Yaw runs under (something)
phrase.description: What does this really mean? It means Yaw runs passing under something

phrase.original: Kojo wura tokuro mu
phrase.translation: Kojo entered a hole

phrase.original: Aba foro adan
phrase.translation: Aba climbs buildings

phrase.original: Kofi hwiri ɛban
phrase.translation: Kofi jumps wall

phrase.original: Kofi wea kɔ ɛdua ase
phrase.translation: Kofi crawls under the tree (directional)
phrase.description: * I was thinking the ase should be a preposition.

phrase.original: Aba fi fie kɔ sukuu
phrase.translation: Aba leaves the house to go to school

phrase.original: Aba fa sukuu ba fie
phrase.translation: Aba passes the school on the way home

phrase.original: Ato hwiee nsuo faa tokuro mu
phrase.translation: Ato poured water through the hole

phrase.original: Yaa pia Kofi fi mpa no so hwe fam
phrase.translation: Yaa pushed Kofi from on top of the bed to the floor

phrase.original: Aba twi kaa fi fie fa sukuu kɔ aɔsre
phrase.translation: Aba drives a car from the house through the school to church

phrase.original: Akwankyerɛde no kyerɛ benkum
phrase.translation: the signpost points to the left

phrase.original: Yaw dwane fa dwaso
phrase.translation: Yaw runs passing the market

phrase.original: Yaw dwane fa tokuro mu
phrase.translation: Yaw runs through the tunnel

phrase.original: Aba faa sukuu no mfonyi baa fie
phrase.translation: Aba took a picture of the school home

phrase.original: Na nkura bi te fie bi mu.
Saa fie no ara mu na na ɔkra bi teɛ.
Na ɔkyekyere nkura no we anɔpa ne anwummerɛ biara.
phrase.translation: He caught the mice and ate them every morning and evening.

phrase.original: Nkura no nyinaa hyiaa mu dwenee ɔkwan a wɔbɛfa so atena asomdwoeɛ mu a ɔkra ntumi nkye wɔn.
phrase.translation: the mice met to think of a way to live together so that the cat would not be able to catch them.

phrase.original: Akura baako de adwene bi baa sɛ nkura no nyinaa nyɛ adwene na wɔnkɔto nhyɛ ɔkra so na wɔntete no pasapasa.
phrase.translation: One mouse suggested that they all pounce on the cat and tear him to pieces.

phrase.original: Nanso wɔn a aka no ampene saa adwenkyerɛ yi so ɛfiri sɛ na wɔnim sɛ ɔkra ho yɛ den kyɛn wɔn nyinaa.
Ɔbaako nso kaa sɛ wɔmfa adɔma nkɔto ɔkra no kɔn mu sɛdeɛ ɛbɛyɛ na ɔreba a wɔbɛte ne nka na wɔadwane.
phrase.translation: Another also suggested that they put a bell around the neck of the cat so that they will know when he is coming.

phrase.original: Wɔn nyinaa gye too mu sɛ ɛyɛ adwene pa.
Nkurahene sɔre bisaa wɔn sɛ, hwan na ɔde adɔma no bɛkɔ akɔsɛn ɔkra kɔn mu?
phrase.translation: The chief stood up and asked that who will go and hung the bell on the neck of the cat?

phrase.original: Dwam hɔ tɛm dinn.
Oyi sɔre a ɔse me deɛ mesua, oyi sɔre a ɔse me deɛ meyare.
Obiara kaa asɛm de yii ne ho ano nti ɔhene no kaa sɛ wɔnntumi nyɛ ho hwee enti obiara nhwɛ ne ho so yie.
Wɔn nyinaa gyee bɔɔ.
Ɔhene tirimuɔdenfoɔ bi tenaa ase.
phrase.translation: there lived a wicked chief.

phrase.original: Da bi ɔhyɛɛ mmara sɛ wɔnkumkum nkɔkoraa ne mmerewa mfiri ne man mu.
phrase.translation: one day he passed a law that every old man and woman in his town should be killed.

phrase.original: Obiara de hu dii so gye aberanteɛ baako pɛ na ɔtumi den'akɔkoraa sieeɛ.
phrase.translation: everyone obeyed with fear except one youngman who was able to hide his oldman.

phrase.original: Mfeɛ kakra bi akyi no, Ɔhene yi hyɛɛ abɔfoɔ a wɔwɔ ne man mu sɛ ɔpɛ sɛ ne ho yɛ hu te sɛ Ɔsebɔ enti wɔnkɔkum Ɔsebɔ na wɔmfa ne nwoma mmɛdura ne ho.
Ankyɛ na owia branee bi bɔeɛ, na ɛrekɔ anwummerɛ no na Ɔhene ano da mu deɛ ɛyɛ den.
Nwoma no akyekyere no ma ɔgye ne ho a ɛnnye.
Wɔnhunu ɔkwan nso a wɔmfa so nyi nwoma no mfiri ne ho.
Ɛhɔ ara na aberanteɛ yi wiaa ne ho kɔkaa deɛ asie kyerɛe n'akɔkora.
Ɔkyerɛɛ sɛ Ɔhene yi nkɔda nsuom mmerɛ tiawa bi na ɔbɛtumi aworɔ nwoma no.
Berɛ a abarenteɛ yi bɛka kyerɛɛ Ɔhene na ɔyɛɛ saa no, ɔtumi yii nwoma no maa ne ho tɔɔ no.
Afei Ɔhene nuu ne ho sɛ wadi mmɔfrasɛm a ɛte saa.
Ɔsoma maa wokɔfaa akɔkoraa yi bɛtenaa n’ahemfie.
Wɔ dii so de Ɔsebɔ nwoma mono duraa ne ho ma ɔsɛɛ Ɔsebɔ ampa.
phrase.translation: they obeyed and covered him with the skin of a tiger and he really looked like a tiger.

phrase.original: John bɔɔ ɔkraman no kuu no.
phrase.translation: John beat the dog to death.

phrase.original: John bɔɔ ɔkraman no maa no wui.
phrase.translation: John beat the dog to death.

phrase.original: Kwaku retɔ dan no.
phrase.translation: Kwaku is buying the house.

phrase.original: Kwaku bɛtɔ dan no.
phrase.translation: Kwaku will buy the house.

phrase.original: Kwaku ntɔ dan no.
phrase.translation: Kwaku is not buying the house/ Kwaku will not buy the house.

phrase.original: Ama atɔ atadeɛ.
phrase.translation: Ama has bought a dress.

phrase.original: Ama ntɔɔ atadeɛ.
phrase.translation: Ama hasn't bought a dress.

phrase.original: Kofi ankɔtɔ eduane andi.
phrase.translation: Kofi did not buy food to eat

phrase.original: Yaa bɛtɔ brodeɛ anoa adi ada.
phrase.translation: Yaa will buy plantain, cook, eat and sleep.

phrase.original: ɔkyerɛma no rebɔ twenee to nnwom.
phrase.translation: The drummer is playing the drum and singing
